Question: What materials were used in constructing the Great Wall of China?

question: What materials were used in constructing the Great Wall of China?
retrieved_documents:
The Great Wall of China is over 13,000 miles long.
Construction of the Great Wall of China began in the 7th century BC.
The Great Wall of China was built to protect against invasions from northern tribes.
The Great Wall of China is a UNESCO World Heritage site.
The Great Wall of China is made of various materials, including stone, brick, tamped earth, and wood.
The height of the Great Wall of China varies, with the tallest sections reaching up to 7.8 meters (25.6 feet).
The total length of the Great Wall of China, including all its branches, is approximately 21,196 kilometers (13,171 miles).
The Great Wall of China is not a single continuous wall but a series of walls and fortifications built by different dynasties over centuries.
